channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report E-2024050055
item.description:
Report E-2024050055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: WALTERBORO
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding five torn 55lb bags of Caustic Soda Beads. The reason for the incident is improper loading as the bags were torn by the trailer wall. This resulted in an estimated release of 250lbs of product onto the wooden trailer floor in a 15’x4’ area. A Contractor was called to overpack the damaged bags, cut-up the impacted tote, neutralize the trailer floor using a Vinegar Solution, and containerized the ripped shrink wrap. One 55-gallon DF was generated for waste disposal. The remaining product was repalletized and will ship on to the Consignee. No storm-drains, waterways or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024050001
item.description:
Report E-2024050001

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: PIEDMONT
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized cleaners and absorbent pads to remove all material from the impacted area. The damaged pail and all spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

item.description:
Report X-2024050012

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO CENTER, CLERK WRAPPED IN TWO PLASTIC BAGS. CLERK INFORMED RMP THAT SHE HAD RECEIVED A LEAKING PACKAGE. RMP OBSERVED THAT PACKAGE WAS A HAZMAT AND CONTACTED DESIGNATED RESPONDER TO COLLECT AND PROCESS THE PACKAGE PER THE DMP PROCEDURE.
